msContents.summary:
I) Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael (fols. 4ra-87va) I-1) Introduction (fol. 4ra-7va) I-2) Homily by Timothy (Dämatewos), Patriarch [of Alexandria] for the 12th of Ḫǝdar (fols. 7va-15va); miracle (fols. 15va-16vb); commemorative notice (fols. 16vb-17rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 17rb) I-3) Homily by Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs the Orthodox for the 12th of Taḫśaś [Miyazya] (fols. 17rb-22ra); miracle (fol. 22ra-vb); commemorative notice (fol. 23ra-va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 23va) I-4) Homily by an anonymous author for the 12th of Ṭǝrr [Taḫśaś] (fols. 23vb-29va); miracle (fol. 29va-30ra); commemorative notice (fol. 30rb-va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 30va) I-5) Homily by an anonymous author for the 12th of Yäkkatit (fols. 30va-34ra); miracle (fol. 34ra-vb); commemorative notice (fol. 35ra-rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 35rb) I-6) Homily by Yoḥannǝs [Severus], Metropolitan [Patriarch] of Antiochia for the 12th of Mäggabit (fols. 35rb-50ra); miracle (fols. 50ra-51rb); commemorative notice (fol. 51rb-va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 51va) I-7) Homily [by Epiphanius, Metropolitan of Cyprus] for the 12th of Miyazya [Ṭǝrr] (fols. 51va-57ra); miracle (fols. 57ra-58va); commemorative notice (fol. 58va-vb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 58vb-59ra) I-8) Homily by Yoḥannǝs, Metropolitan of Ethiopia for Gǝnbot (fols. 59ra-60va); miracle (fols. 60va-61vb); commemorative notice (fols. 61vb-62ra); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 62ra-rb) I-9) Homily by Yoḥannǝs, Metropolitan of Aksum (ʾAkwǝsum) for Säne (fols. 62rb-67va); miracle (fols. 67vb-68vb); commemorative notice (fols. 68vb-69va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 69va) I-10) Homily by Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs for Ḥamle (fols. 69va-73vb); miracle (fols. 73vb-74va); commemorative notice (fols. 74va-75ra); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 75ra) I-11) Homily by an anonymous author for Näḥase (fols. 75ra-78ra); miracle (fol. 78ra-vb); commemorative notice (fols. 78vb-79ra); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 79ra) I-12) Homily by an anonymous author for Mäskäräm (fols. 79ra-81vb); miracle (fols. 81vb-82ra); commemorative notice (fol. 82rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 82rb-va) I-13) Homily by an anonymous author for Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 82va-86va); miracle (fol. 86va-vb); commemorative notice (fols. 86vb-87va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 87va) I-14) Account of the eschatological war between Archangel Michael and Satan including a description of Satan's physical appearance (fols. 87vb-88vb) II) Mälkǝʾa Mikaʾel "Image of Michael" (fols. 88vb-92vb) (cp. ChRep no. 119)
Colophon.
msContents.colophon: f. 92vb: ተፈጸመ፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ በእደ፡ ጸሐፌሁ፡ ቄስ፡ ደስታ፡ ገ/ማርያም፡ ዘብሔረ፡ ልጋት፡ በ፲ወ፱፻፷ወ፭ዓመተ፡ ምሕረት። ወተሣየጦ፡ በ፹ወ፭ብሩር፡ [vac.] ወወሀቦ፡ ለታቦተ፡ ማርያም፡ ዓዲ፡ ቀያሕቶ። ዘሠረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጲጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን፡ ለይኩን፡ ለይኩን።This book was completed by the hand of the scribe priest Dästa Gabra Māryām from the land of Lǝgat in the year of mercy 1965. [vac.] He has purchased it for 85 Bǝrr and donated it to the church of Mary ʿAddi Qiyaḥto. The one who stole it or erased (its text) shall be excommunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul. For ever and ever. Amen and amen. Let it be, let it be. The year of mercy 1965 corresponds to 1972/73 A.D. The space for the name of the commissioner has been left unfilled (?).

decoDesc.decoNote: Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist, names of the donor and other persons; groups of lines on the incipit page; incipit of all sections; incipit or the initial word of subsections; the word salām "salutation"; the word bä-ʾǝntä "about" on fol. 62ra; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
f. 4r (incipit page Text I-1): elaborate coloured (red, green, black) ornamental band with one central and two lateral pendants reaching the bottom of the page; interlaces.
f. 23va (explicit of Text I-3): coloured (red, black) ornamental band; interlaces.
f. 88vb (incipit of Text III): coloured (red, black) ornamental band; interlaces and floral motifs.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; leather inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.
Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: triple line fillet, interlaced line fillet, double circle, double crescent with eye, cross hatching).

origin.origDate: According to the colophon, the Ms. was written in 1972/73 A.D.

person.persName: The following persons are mentioned in the supplication formulas (inserted in the main hand and in a secondary hand): Gabra Krǝstos and his wife Walatta Hāymānot, Tasfā Mikāʾel, Walatta Mikāʾel, Tasfā Māryām, Takla Māryām.
